intro: Echeandia graminea, commonly known as the slender grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Echeandia graminea is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
